module.name: UCD-SNMP-MIB
module.contact:
This mib is no longer being maintained by the University of California and is now in life-support-mode and being maintained by the net-snmp project. The best place to write for public questions about the net-snmp-coders mailing list at net-snmp-coders@lists.sourceforge.net.
postal: Wes Hardaker P.O. Box 382 Davis CA 95617
email: net-snmp-coders@lists.sourceforge.net
module.description: This file defines the private UCD SNMP MIB extensions.

revision.description: New 64-bit objects for monitoring large disk usage
Clarify behaviour of objects in the memory & systemStats groups (including updated versions of malnamed mem*Text objects). Define suitable TCs to describe error reporting/fix behaviour.
Added ssCpuRawSoftIRQ for Linux (2.6) and forgotten raw swap counters.
Added raw CPU and IO counters.
SMIv2 version converted from older MIB definitions.

typedef.name: Float
typedef.description:
A single precision floating-point number. The semantics and encoding are identical for type 'single' defined in IEEE Standard for Binary Floating-Point, ANSI/IEEE Std 754-1985. The value is restricted to the BER serialization of the following ASN.1 type: FLOATTYPE ::= [120] IMPLICIT FloatType (note: the value 120 is the sum of '30'h and '48'h) The BER serialization of the length for values of this type must use the definite length, short encoding form.
For example, the BER serialization of value 123 of type FLOATTYPE is '9f780442f60000'h. (The tag is '9f78'h; the length is '04'h; and the value is '42f60000'h.) The BER serialization of value '9f780442f60000'h of data type Opaque is '44079f780442f60000'h. (The tag is '44'h; the length is '07'h; and the value is '9f780442f60000'h.

typedef.name: UCDErrorFix
typedef.description: Represents a 'push-button' object, to invoke a suitable configured action. Will always return 0 when read.

table.name: prTable
table.description: A table containing information on running programs/daemons configured for monitoring in the snmpd.conf file of the agent. Processes violating the number of running processes required by the agent's configuration file are flagged with numerical and textual errors.

row.name: prEntry
row.description: An entry containing a process and its statistics.

column.name: prIndex
column.description: Reference Index for each observed process.

column.name: prNames
column.description: The process name we're counting/checking on.

column.name: prMin
column.description: The minimum number of processes that should be running. An error flag is generated if the number of running processes is < the minimum.

column.name: prMax
column.description: The maximum number of processes that should be running. An error flag is generated if the number of running processes is > the maximum.

column.name: prCount
column.description: The number of current processes running with the name in question.

column.name: prErrorFlag
column.description: A Error flag to indicate trouble with a process. It goes to 1 if there is an error, 0 if no error.

column.name: prErrMessage
column.description: An error message describing the problem (if one exists).

column.name: prErrFix
column.description: Setting this to one will try to fix the problem if the agent has been configured with a script to call to attempt to fix problems automatically using remote snmp operations.

column.name: prErrFixCmd
column.description: The command that gets run when the prErrFix column is set to 1.

scalar.name: memIndex
scalar.description: Bogus Index. This should always return the integer 0.

scalar.name: memErrorName
scalar.description: Bogus Name. This should always return the string 'swap'.

scalar.name: memTotalSwap
scalar.description: The total amount of swap space configured for this host.

scalar.name: memAvailSwap
scalar.description: The amount of swap space currently unused or available.

scalar.name: memTotalReal
scalar.description: The total amount of real/physical memory installed on this host.

scalar.name: memAvailReal
scalar.description: The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available.

scalar.name: memTotalSwapTXT
scalar.description:
The total amount of swap space or virtual memory allocated for text pages on this host.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not distinguish text pages from other uses of swap space or virtual memory.

scalar.name: memAvailSwapTXT
scalar.description:
The amount of swap space or virtual memory currently being used by text pages on this host.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not distinguish text pages from other uses of swap space or virtual memory.
Note that (despite the name), this value reports the amount used, rather than the amount free or available for use. For clarity, this object is being deprecated in favour of 'memUsedSwapTXT(16).

scalar.name: memTotalRealTXT
scalar.description:
The total amount of real/physical memory allocated for text pages on this host.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not distinguish text pages from other uses of physical memory.

scalar.name: memAvailRealTXT
scalar.description:
The amount of real/physical memory currently being used by text pages on this host.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not distinguish text pages from other uses of physical memory.
Note that (despite the name), this value reports the amount used, rather than the amount free or available for use. For clarity, this object is being deprecated in favour of 'memUsedRealTXT(17).

scalar.name: memTotalFree
scalar.description: The total amount of memory free or available for use on this host. This value typically covers both real memory and swap space or virtual memory.

scalar.name: memMinimumSwap
scalar.description:
The minimum amount of swap space expected to be kept free or available during normal operation of this host.
If this value (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)') falls below the specified level, then 'memSwapError(100)' will be set to 1 and an error message made available via 'memSwapErrorMsg(101)'.

scalar.name: memShared
scalar.description:
The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as shared memory.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not explicitly identify memory as specifically reserved for this purpose.

scalar.name: memBuffer
scalar.description:
The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as memory buffers.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not explicitly identify memory as specifically reserved for this purpose.

scalar.name: memCached
scalar.description:
The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated for use as cached memory.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not explicitly identify memory as specifically reserved for this purpose.

scalar.name: memUsedSwapTXT
scalar.description:
The amount of swap space or virtual memory currently being used by text pages on this host.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not distinguish text pages from other uses of swap space or virtual memory.

scalar.name: memUsedRealTXT
scalar.description:
The amount of real/physical memory currently being used by text pages on this host.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not distinguish text pages from other uses of physical memory.

scalar.name: memSwapError
scalar.description: Indicates whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)').

scalar.name: memSwapErrorMsg
scalar.description: Describes whether the amount of available swap space (as reported by 'memAvailSwap(4)'), is less than the desired minimum (specified by 'memMinimumSwap(12)').

table.name: extTable
table.description: A table of extensible commands returning output and result codes. These commands are configured via the agent's snmpd.conf file.

row.name: extEntry
row.description: An entry containing an extensible script/program and its output.

column.name: extIndex
column.description: Reference Index for extensible scripts. Simply an integer row number.

column.name: extNames
column.description: A Short, one name description of the extensible command.

column.name: extCommand
column.description: The command line to be executed.

column.name: extResult
column.description: The result code (exit status) from the executed command.

column.name: extOutput
column.description: The first line of output of the executed command.

column.name: extErrFix
column.description: Setting this to one will try to fix the problem if the agent has been configured with a script to call to attempt to fix problems automatically using remote snmp operations.

column.name: extErrFixCmd
column.description: The command that gets run when the extErrFix column is set to 1.

table.name: dskTable
table.description: Disk watching information. Partions to be watched are configured by the snmpd.conf file of the agent.

row.name: dskEntry
row.description: An entry containing a disk and its statistics.

column.name: dskIndex
column.description: Integer reference number (row number) for the disk mib.

column.name: dskPath
column.description: Path where the disk is mounted.

column.name: dskDevice
column.description: Path of the device for the partition

column.name: dskMinimum
column.description: Minimum space required on the disk (in kBytes) before the errors are triggered. Either this or dskMinPercent is configured via the agent's snmpd.conf file.

column.name: dskMinPercent
column.description: Percentage of minimum space required on the disk before the errors are triggered. Either this or dskMinimum is configured via the agent's snmpd.conf file.

column.name: dskTotal
column.description: Total size of the disk/partion (kBytes). For large disks (>2Tb), this value will latch at INT32_MAX (2147483647).

column.name: dskAvail
column.description: Available space on the disk. For large lightly-used disks (>2Tb), this value will latch at INT32_MAX (2147483647).

column.name: dskUsed
column.description: Used space on the disk. For large heavily-used disks (>2Tb), this value will latch at INT32_MAX (2147483647).

column.name: dskPercent
column.description: Percentage of space used on disk

column.name: dskPercentNode
column.description: Percentage of inodes used on disk

column.name: dskTotalLow
column.description: Total size of the disk/partion (kBytes). Together with dskTotalHigh composes 64-bit number.

column.name: dskTotalHigh
column.description: Total size of the disk/partion (kBytes). Together with dskTotalLow composes 64-bit number.

column.name: dskAvailLow
column.description: Available space on the disk (kBytes). Together with dskAvailHigh composes 64-bit number.

column.name: dskAvailHigh
column.description: Available space on the disk (kBytes). Together with dskAvailLow composes 64-bit number.

column.name: dskUsedLow
column.description: Used space on the disk (kBytes). Together with dskUsedHigh composes 64-bit number.

column.name: dskUsedHigh
column.description: Used space on the disk (kBytes). Together with dskUsedLow composes 64-bit number.

column.name: dskErrorFlag
column.description: Error flag signaling that the disk or partition is under the minimum required space configured for it.

column.name: dskErrorMsg
column.description: A text description providing a warning and the space left on the disk.

row.name: laEntry
row.description: An entry containing a load average and its values.

column.name: laIndex
column.description: reference index/row number for each observed loadave.

column.name: laNames
column.description: The list of loadave names we're watching.

column.name: laLoad
column.description: The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages (one per row).

column.name: laConfig
column.description: The watch point for load-averages to signal an error. If the load averages rises above this value, the laErrorFlag below is set.

column.name: laLoadInt
column.description: The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages as an integer. This is computed by taking the floating point loadaverage value and multiplying by 100, then converting the value to an integer.

column.name: laLoadFloat
column.description: The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages as an opaquely wrapped floating point number.

column.name: laErrorFlag
column.description: A Error flag to indicate the load-average has crossed its threshold value defined in the snmpd.conf file. It is set to 1 if the threshold is crossed, 0 otherwise.

column.name: laErrMessage
column.description: An error message describing the load-average and its surpased watch-point value.

scalar.name: ssIndex
scalar.description: Bogus Index. This should always return the integer 1.

scalar.name: ssErrorName
scalar.description: Bogus Name. This should always return the string 'systemStats'.

scalar.name: ssSwapIn
scalar.description: The average amount of memory swapped in from disk, calculated over the last minute.

scalar.name: ssSwapOut
scalar.description: The average amount of memory swapped out to disk, calculated over the last minute.

scalar.name: ssIOSent
scalar.description:
The average amount of data written to disk or other block device, calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssIORawSent(57)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssIOReceive
scalar.description:
The average amount of data read from disk or other block device, calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssIORawReceived(58)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssSysInterrupts
scalar.description:
The average rate of interrupts processed (including the clock) calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssRawInterrupts(59)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssSysContext
scalar.description:
The average rate of context switches, calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssRawContext(60)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssCpuUser
scalar.description:
The percentage of CPU time spent processing user-level code, calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssCpuRawUser(50)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssCpuSystem
scalar.description:
The percentage of CPU time spent processing system-level code, calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssCpuRawSystem(52)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssCpuIdle
scalar.description:
The percentage of processor time spent idle, calculated over the last minute.
This object has been deprecated in favour of 'ssCpuRawIdle(53)', which can be used to calculate the same metric, but over any desired time period.

scalar.name: ssCpuRawUser
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent processing user-level code.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssCpuRawNice
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent processing reduced-priority code.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not measure this particular CPU metric.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssCpuRawSystem
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent processing system-level code.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).
This object may sometimes be implemented as the combination of the 'ssCpuRawWait(54)' and 'ssCpuRawKernel(55)' counters, so care must be taken when summing the overall raw counters.

scalar.name: ssCpuRawIdle
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent idle.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssCpuRawWait
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent waiting for IO.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not measure this particular CPU metric. This time may also be included within the 'ssCpuRawSystem(52)' counter.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssCpuRawKernel
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent processing kernel-level code.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not measure this particular CPU metric. This time may also be included within the 'ssCpuRawSystem(52)' counter.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssCpuRawInterrupt
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent processing hardware interrupts.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not measure this particular CPU metric.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssIORawSent
scalar.description: Number of blocks sent to a block device

scalar.name: ssIORawReceived
scalar.description: Number of blocks received from a block device

scalar.name: ssRawInterrupts
scalar.description: Number of interrupts processed

scalar.name: ssRawContexts
scalar.description: Number of context switches

scalar.name: ssCpuRawSoftIRQ
scalar.description:
The number of 'ticks' (typically 1/100s) spent processing software interrupts.
This object will not be implemented on hosts where the underlying operating system does not measure this particular CPU metric.
On a multi-processor system, the 'ssCpuRaw*' counters are cumulative over all CPUs, so their sum will typically be N*100 (for N processors).

scalar.name: ssRawSwapIn
scalar.description: Number of blocks swapped in

scalar.name: ssRawSwapOut
scalar.description: Number of blocks swapped out

column.name: fileIndex
column.description: Index of file

column.name: fileName
column.description: Filename

column.name: fileSize
column.description: Size of file (kB)

column.name: fileMax
column.description: Limit of filesize (kB)

column.name: fileErrorFlag
column.description: Limit exceeded flag

column.name: fileErrorMsg
column.description: Filesize error message

scalar.name: logMatchMaxEntries
scalar.description: The maximum number of logmatch entries this snmpd daemon can support.

column.name: logMatchIndex
column.description: Index of logmatch

column.name: logMatchName
column.description: logmatch instance name

column.name: logMatchFilename
column.description: filename to be logmatched

column.name: logMatchRegEx
column.description: regular expression

column.name: logMatchGlobalCounter
column.description: global count of matches

column.name: logMatchGlobalCount
column.description: Description.

column.name: logMatchCurrentCounter
column.description: Regex match counter. This counter will be reset with each logfile rotation.

column.name: logMatchCurrentCount
column.description: Description.

column.name: logMatchCounter
column.description: Regex match counter. This counter will be reset with each read

column.name: logMatchCount
column.description: Description.

column.name: logMatchCycle
column.description: time between updates (if not queried) in seconds

column.name: logMatchErrorFlag
column.description: errorflag: is this line configured correctly?

column.name: logMatchRegExCompilation
column.description: message of regex precompilation

column.name: fileIndex
column.description: Index of file

column.name: fileName
column.description: Filename

column.name: fileSize
column.description: Size of file (kB)

column.name: fileMax
column.description: Limit of filesize (kB)

column.name: fileErrorFlag
column.description: Limit exceeded flag

column.name: fileErrorMsg
column.description: Filesize error message

scalar.name: versionIndex
scalar.description: Index to mib (always 0)

scalar.name: versionTag
scalar.description: CVS tag keyword

scalar.name: versionDate
scalar.description: Date string from RCS keyword

scalar.name: versionCDate
scalar.description: Date string from ctime()

scalar.name: versionIdent
scalar.description: Id string from RCS keyword

scalar.name: versionConfigureOptions
scalar.description: Options passed to the configure script when this agent was built.

scalar.name: versionClearCache
scalar.description: Set to 1 to clear the exec cache, if enabled

scalar.name: versionUpdateConfig
scalar.description: Set to 1 to read-read the config file(s).

scalar.name: versionRestartAgent
scalar.description: Set to 1 to restart the agent.

scalar.name: versionSavePersistentData
scalar.description: Set to 1 to force the agent to save it's persistent data immediately.

scalar.name: versionDoDebugging
scalar.description: Set to 1 to turn debugging statements on in the agent or 0 to turn it off.

scalar.name: snmperrIndex
scalar.description: Bogus Index for snmperrs (always 0).

scalar.name: snmperrNames
scalar.description: snmp

scalar.name: snmperrErrorFlag
scalar.description: A Error flag to indicate trouble with the agent. It goes to 1 if there is an error, 0 if no error.

scalar.name: snmperrErrMessage
scalar.description: An error message describing the problem (if one exists).

table.name: mrTable
table.description: A table displaying all the oid's registered by mib modules in the agent. Since the agent is modular in nature, this lists each module's OID it is responsible for and the name of the module

row.name: mrEntry
row.description: An entry containing a registered mib oid.

column.name: mrIndex
column.description: The registry slot of a mibmodule.

column.name: mrModuleName
column.description: The module name that registered this OID.

notification.name: ucdStart
notification.description: This trap could in principle be sent when the agent start

notification.name: ucdShutdown
notification.description: This trap is sent when the agent terminates
